1991.note: The United States recognized the Russian Federation as the successor to the Soviet Union on December 25, 1991, when President George H.W. Bush announced the decision in an address to the nation. Bush also stated that the Embassy in Moscow would remain in place as the American Embassy to Russia. On December 8, 1991, the leaders of Russia, Belarus, and Ukraine had declared that the Soviet Union ceased to exist and proclaimed a "Commonwealth of Independent States" (CIS) that eleven former Soviet Republics joined on December 21. The formal dissolution of the Soviet Union was completed when Mikhail Gorbachev resigned as President on December 25, 1991.

2011.note: U.S. relations with Libya deteriorated after actions by Mu'ammar al-Qadafi to squelch an insurrection against his regime. Ambassador Christopher Stevens and members of his staff were killed on September 11, 2012 in an attack on the U.S. Mission in Benghazi.
